question: Determine the leader of the Soviet Union whose death critically influenced armistice negotiations concluding a specific Cold War conflict, given that this conflict began in the same year as the founding of China's national film academy (assume the academy operates under the Ministry of Culture and trains directors for a transformative cinematic movement when establishing its founding year), with the constraint that the leader died during negotiations and prompted diplomatic communications accelerating peace talks within days of the death.
subject: web
constant_ev: Assume the film academy is established under the Ministry of Culture and instrumental in training directors of a transformative cinematic movement when identifying the academy's founding year
derived_ev: The Beijing Film Academy was founded in May/June 1950
The Korean War began on June 25, 1950 and is recognized as the first major armed conflict of the Cold War era
The Berlin Blockade (1948-1949) was an earlier Cold War confrontation but not an armed conflict
The first major armed conflict of the Cold War era that began in the same year as the founding of China's national film academy is the Korean War
Joseph Stalin died on March 5, 1953 during the Korean War armistice negotiations and his death directly influenced the new Soviet leadership's urgency to resolve the conflict

Soviet Foreign Minister Vyacheslav Molotov explicitly cited 'new leadership circumstances' in communications to North Korea on March 10, 1953 accelerating peace talks that had been deadlocked under Stalin's directives
The leader of the Soviet Union whose death critically influenced the 1953 armistice negotiations of the Korean War was Joseph Stalin

tier1_result.reasoning: They disagree because the solver returned "NO_ANSWER" instead of the correct expected answer "Joseph Stalin". The expected answer is well-supported by historical evidence (Stalin died on March 5, 1953, which aligns with the relevant events) and there is no ambiguity.

validated_devs: The Beijing Film Academy was founded in May/June 1950
The Korean War began on June 25, 1950 and is recognized as the first major armed conflict of the Cold War era
The Berlin Blockade (1948-1949) was an earlier Cold War confrontation but not an armed conflict
The first major armed conflict of the Cold War era that began in the same year as the founding of China's national film academy is the Korean War
Joseph Stalin died on March 5, 1953 during the Korean War armistice negotiations and his death directly influenced the new Soviet leadership's urgency to resolve the conflict
The leader of the Soviet Union whose death critically influenced the 1953 armistice negotiations of the Korean War was Joseph Stalin
rejected_devs: Soviet Foreign Minister Vyacheslav Molotov explicitly cited 'new leadership circumstances' in communications to North Korea on March 10, 1953 accelerating peace talks that had been deadlocked under Stalin's directives
tier2_result.reasoning: They agree because the solver's answer "Joseph Stalin" is identical to the expected answer. The timeline and facts—Beijing Film Academy founded in 1950, Korean War starting in June 1950, and Stalin's death in March 1953 which accelerated armistice negotiations—support this.
